question.title: Unable to switch back to vertx event loop thread pool after switching to executor thread pool
question.body:
@GET
@Path("/p1")
public Uni<Response> p1() {
    Log.info("Entry (event loop)");

    return Uni.createFrom()
            .item("input")
            .onItem().transform(input -> {
                Log.info("Light transform");
                return input.toUpperCase();
            })
            .emitOn(Infrastructure.getDefaultWorkerPool()) // ‚Üê Switch to worker
            .onItem().transform(data -> {
                Log.info("Heavy work (worker)");
                try {
                    Thread.sleep(1000);
                } catch (InterruptedException ignored) {
                }
                return "Processed: " + data;
            })
            .emitOn(Infrastructure.getDefaultExecutor()) // doesn't work
            .onItem().transform(result -> {
                Log.info("Back on event loop");
                return Response.ok(result).build();
            });
}

2025-08-11 04:13:58,404 INFO [com.exa.ExampleResource] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-1) Entry (event loop)
2025-08-11 04:13:58,405 INFO [com.exa.ExampleResource] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-1) Light transform
2025-08-11 04:13:58,405 INFO [com.exa.ExampleResource] (executor-thread-1) Heavy work (worker)
2025-08-11 04:13:59,407 INFO [com.exa.ExampleResource] (executor-thread-1) Back on event loop

I am unable to switch back to the event loop thread by using emitOn(Infrastructure.getDefaultExecutor()).
What am I doing wrong?
How can I go back to the event loop after doing CPU-intensive work inthe worker thread pool?
